it.emarolab.owloop.core

Interface Semantic.Descriptor<O,J>

  • Type Parameters:
    O - the type of ontology in which the axioms will be applied. It defines the related Semantic.Ground parameter for this descriptor.
    J - the type of instance (i.e.: subject) for the axioms. It defines the related Semantic.Ground parameter for this descriptor.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Semantic
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Concept<O,J>, Concept.Classify<O,J,Y,D>, Concept.Define<O,J,Y>, Concept.Disjoint<O,J,D>, Concept.Equivalent<O,J,D>, Concept.Sub<O,J,D>, Concept.Super<O,J,D>, DataProperty<O,J>, DataProperty.Disjoint<O,J,D>, DataProperty.Domain<O,J,Y>, DataProperty.Equivalent<O,J,D>, DataProperty.Range<O,J,Y>, DataProperty.Sub<O,J,D>, DataProperty.Super<O,J,D>, Individual<O,J>, Individual.DataLink<O,J,Y,S,D>, Individual.Disjoint<O,J,D>, Individual.Equivalent<O,J,D>, Individual.ObjectLink<O,J,Y,S,D>, Individual.Type<O,J,Y,D>, MORConcept, MORConcept.Classify<D>, MORConcept.Define, MORConcept.Disjoint<D>, MORConcept.Equivalent<D>, MORConcept.Sub<D>, MORConcept.Super<D>, MORDataProperty, MORDataProperty.Disjoint<D>, MORDataProperty.Domain, MORDataProperty.Equivalent<D>, MORDataProperty.Range, MORDataProperty.Sub<D>, MORDataProperty.Super<D>, MORIndividual, MORIndividual.DataLink<D>, MORIndividual.Disjoint<D>, MORIndividual.Equivalent<D>, MORIndividual.ObjectLink<D>, MORIndividual.Type<D>, MORObjectProperty, MORObjectProperty.Disjoint<D>, MORObjectProperty.Domain, MORObjectProperty.Equivalent<D>, MORObjectProperty.Inverse<D>, MORObjectProperty.Range, MORObjectProperty.Sub<D>, MORObjectProperty.Super<D>, ObjectProperty<O,J>, ObjectProperty.Disjoint<O,J,D>, ObjectProperty.Domain<O,J,Y>, ObjectProperty.Equivalent<O,J,D>, ObjectProperty.Inverse<O,J,D>, ObjectProperty.Range<O,J,Y>, ObjectProperty.Sub<O,J,D>, ObjectProperty.Super<O,J,D>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MORBase, MORClassifyConcept, MORConceptBase, MORDataPropertyBase, MORDefinitionConcept, MORDefinitionDataProperty, MORDefinitionIndividual, MORDefinitionObjectProperty, MORDomainDataProperty, MORDomainObjectProperty, MORFullConcept, MORFullDataProperty, MORFullIndividual, MORFullObjectProperty, MORHierarchicalConcept, MORHierarchicalDataProperty, MORHierarchicalObjectProperty, MORIndividualBase, MORLinkIndividual, MORObjectPropertyBase, MORTypeIndividual
    Enclosing interface:
    Semantic

    public static interface Semantic.Descriptor<O,J>
extends Semantic
    The interface to read and write from the ontology specific Semantic.Axioms or Semantic.SemanticAxioms.

    This class is the core of the OWLOOP implementation and is in charge to maintain the Semantic.Axioms and Semantic.SemanticAxioms synchronised with respect to an OWL representation (i.e.: Semantic.Ground).
    The paradigm through which this implement OWL accessibility through an OOP approach is given by the fact that a generic OWLLOOP class can implement several descriptors (all related to the same Semantic.Ground). Doing so it enhance its feature to represent different OWL description of the same entities and gains the possibility to access them through OOP paradigms. This is true, given a correct reading and writing policy that the developer should manage.

    File: it.emarolab.owloop.core.Semantic
    Licence: GNU GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE. Version 3, 29 June 2007
    Author: Buoncompagni Luca (luca.buoncompagni@edu.unige.it)

    date: 21/05/17

    • Method Detail

      • getGround

        Semantic.Ground<O,J> getGround()
        Returns the grounding element for this descriptor.
        Returns:
        the instances using during writeSemantic() and readSemantic() to synchronise the described Semantic.Axioms (or Semantic.SemanticAxioms).

      • getOntology

        default O getOntology()
        Returns the ontology in which the description is operating its synchronisations. It just calls: {@link #getGround()}.getGroundOntology().
        Returns:
        the ontology in which this description is working on.

      • getInstance

        default J getInstance()
        Returns the instance in the ontology in which the description is applying the relative axioms (i.e.: subject). It just calls: {@link #getGround()}.getGroundInstance().
        Returns:
        the instance in the ontology with which this description is working on.

      • groundReason

        default void groundReason()
        This method synchronise the reasoner among all the ontology of this description. It calls: {@link #getGround()}.groundReason()

      • readSemantic

        java.util.List<Semantic.MappingIntent> readSemantic()
        This method is used to synchronise specific Semantic.Axioms (or Semantic.SemanticAxioms) from the ontology. It manipulates the OWLLOOP representation to be equal to the queried OWL structure. It is based on Axioms#synchroniseFrom(Axioms).
        Returns:
        the changes made in the Semantic.Axioms during the reading. Those objects may not have the Semantic.MappingIntent.getOntologyChanges() field initialised (i.e.: Void).

      • writeSemantic

        java.util.List<Semantic.MappingIntent> writeSemantic()
        This method is used to synchronise specific Semantic.Axioms (or Semantic.SemanticAxioms) to the ontology. It manipulates the OWL representation to be equal to the OWLOOP structure. It is based on Axioms#synchroniseTo(Axioms).
        Returns:
        the changes made in the OWL ontology during the writing. Those objects may have the Semantic.MappingIntent.getOntologyChanges() field initialised (i.e.: OWLOntologyChange).

      • writeSemanticInconsistencySafe

        default java.util.List<Semantic.MappingIntent> writeSemanticInconsistencySafe(boolean reason)
        This method assure that after writeSemantic() the actual OWLLOOP representation is consistent (only for this descriptor) with the OWL ontology. In fact the new written entities may trigger the reasoner in inferring new elements in the described Semantic.Axioms set. This method, after calling writeSemantic() it calls also groundReason() and than, readSemantic(), in order to add the new inferred elements in the described set.
        Parameters:
        reason - set to false to disable reasoning. This will add only asserted elements;
        Returns:
        the changes made by the writeSemantic() and readSemantic() operations.

      • writeSemanticInconsistencySafe

        default java.util.List<Semantic.MappingIntent> writeSemanticInconsistencySafe()
        This method assure that after writeSemantic() the actual OWLLOOP representation is consistent (only for this descriptor) with the OWL ontology. In fact the new written entities may trigger the reasoner in inferring new elements in the described Semantic.Axioms set. This method class a writeSemantic() and than readSemantic(), in order to add the new inferred elements in the described set.
        Returns:
        the changes made by the writeSemantic() and readSemantic() operations.

      • getIntent

        default java.util.List<Semantic.MappingIntent> getIntent(Semantic.Axioms.SynchronisationIntent sync)
        It instanciate a lists of Semantic.MappingIntent with the given parameters and Void as Semantic.MappingIntent.getOntologyChanges(), which will be null. This is just an helper that can be used by the implementation of the readSemantic(), in order to obtain the value to be returned, based from the results of Axioms#synchroniseFrom(Axioms).
        Parameters:
        sync - the results of a specific call to Axioms#synchroniseFrom(Axioms).
        Returns:
        the changes based on the input parameters.

      • getChangingIntent

        default <C> java.util.List<Semantic.MappingIntent> getChangingIntent(Semantic.Axioms.SynchronisationIntent sync,
                                                                     C changes)
        It instanciate a lists of Semantic.MappingIntent with the given parameters and C as Semantic.MappingIntent.getOntologyChanges(), (e.g.: OWLOntologyChange). This is just an helper that can be used by the implementation of the writeSemantic(), in order to obtain the value to be returned, based from the results of Axioms#synchroniseTo(Axioms) and aMOR manipulations.
        Type Parameters:
        C - the types of ontology changes attached to this intent.
        Parameters:
        sync - the results of a specific call to Axioms#synchroniseTo(Axioms).
        changes - the ontology changes made during writing.
        Returns:
        the changes based on the input parameters.
